frame.name: Physical_artworks
frame.definition:
<def-root>A physical object, the <fen>Artifact</fen>, is produced by a <fen>Creator</fen> to stimulate the perceptions, emotions, or cognition of an audience. Though it need not, in many cases, the created <fen>Artifact</fen> is intended to represent an actual or imagined entity or event, the <fen>Represented</fen>. The <fen>Represented</fen> may be specifically shown in a particular state (<fen>State_of_represented</fen>).
<ex>Sir Denis Mahon is the owner of the most important private collection of <fex name="Time_of_creation">Italian Baroque</fex> <t><fex name="Artifact">paintings</fex></t>.</ex>
<ex>He presented Eddie with a <fex name="Type">watercolour</fex> <t><fex name="Artifact">painting</fex></t> and a bouquet of flowers to his wife Frances</ex>
<ex>I just took a <t>picture</t> <fex name="Represented">of the screen</fex> and plan to share it with 6.4 billion of my closest friends on the Internet tonight.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Artifact
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the entity or substance that is designed to have a particular <fen>Use</fen>.
<ex>The first of the two <t><fex name="Artifact">drawings</fex></t> by Parmigianino recently acquired for the National Gallery is a study for the Madonna dal collo lungo.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition:
<def-root>The use for which the <fen>Artifact</fen> is intended.
<ex>The author's lucid text and <fex name="Use">instructional</fex> <t>drawings</t> provide a strong foundation in the basic and functional anatomy of the pain's region.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition:
<def-root>An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Artifact</fen> into existence.
<ex><fex name="Creator">Italian</fex> <t>paintings</t> include an allegorical work by Garofalo which was mentioned in Vasari 's ` Vite ' .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which an <fen>Artifact</fen> comes into existence.
<ex>Here's a <fex name="Time_of_creation">1987</fex> <t>photo</t> of how the Union School building had deteriorated after many years of neglect.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition:
<def-root>The term used to refer to an <fen>Artifact</fen>.
<ex>In his <t>painting</t> <fex name="Name">The Fall of Man</fex> Albrecht went through a hard time trying to achieve a geometrical figure of two beings known as man and woman.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition:
<def-root>An indication of the subtype of <fen>Artifact</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="Type">Impressionist style</fex> <t>paintings</t> of 1896-7 are rare but of great interest</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any indication of what makes up the <fen>Artifact</fen>, including components, ingredients, etc.
<ex>The exhibition also features a <fex name="Material">marble</fex> <t>statue</t> of a naked Aphrodite crouching at her bath</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Represented
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity--which may be a thing, an action or a state--that is represented by the <fen>Artifact</fen>.
<ex>I was able to take a fine <t>photo</t> <fex name="rep">of his arrival</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: State_of_represented
FE.definition:
<def-root>A characterization of the state in which the <fen>Represented</fen> entity is portrayed.
<ex>Within the church is the <t>painting</t> of Virgin Mary <fex name="sta">sitting on the throne holding a child among various saints</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies a characteristic, description, or evaluation of the <fen>Artifact</fen>.
<ex>The cover features a <fex name="Descriptor">horrible</fex> <t>photo</t> of the man.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location where the <fen>Artifact</fen> is presently located.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: photograph.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a picture made with a camera, in which an image is focused on to film and then made visible and permanent by chemical treatment

lexUnit.name: picture.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a painting, drawing, or photograph.

lexUnit.name: drawing.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a picture or diagram made with a pencil, pen, or crayon rather than paint, especially one drawn in monochrome

lexUnit.name: statue.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a carved or cast figure of a person or animal, especially one that is life-size or larger

lexUnit.name: bronze.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a work of sculpture or other object made of bronze.

lexUnit.name: diagram.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a simplified drawing showing the appearance or structure of something.

lexUnit.name: sculpture.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a three-dimensional, solid piece of artwork, typically made from wood, metal, or plaster.

lexUnit.name: image.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a physical representation of a visual stimulus

lexUnit.name: poster.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a mass-produced piece of art (often a reproduction of a painting or photograph) printed on a large piece of thick paper and designed to be put on a wall.

lexUnit.name: trace.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a drawing produced by copying the lines of an original image

lexUnit.name: tracing.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a drawing produced by copying the lines of an original image
